name: Programmable Privacy on the Application and Protocol Layers
description: Programmable privacy has recently come into focus as a way to empower users in the context of MEV. Privacy-centric projects, such as Penumbra and Aztec, have been exploring programmable privacy from a different lens. What classes of applications need programmable privacy, and what are the best practices in designing them? What are the minimal cryptographic features that a protocol must have to support a private application?

speakers.name: Ying Tong
speakers.bio: Ying Tong is an applied cryptographer at Geometry Research and a maintainer of the halo2 library. She is interested in building privacy-enhancing applications. She also contributes to the Zcash and Ethereum projects.
